715891f-a.text:
Academy Street (center of view running from left to right), east from West 201st Street to the Harlem River (right), showing the power house of the United Electric Light and Power Co. Also shown is a general view northeastward of the Bronx, across the Harlem River, with the building of New York University visible on the right, as seen across Shermans Creek (in inlet of the River) from the slopes of Highbridge Park on the west side of Dyckman Street.
October 26, 1927.
P. L. Speer

715891f-b.text:
Academy Street (center of view running from left to right), east from West 201st Street to the Harlem River (right), showing the power house of the United Electric Light and Power Co. Also shown is a general view northeastward of the Bronx, across the Harlem River, with the building of New York University visible on the right, as seen across Shermans Creek (in inlet of the River) from the slopes of Highbridge Park on the west side of Dyckman Street.

P. L. Speer

715892f-b.text:
(1)
Academy Street, east from, and including West 20lst Street, to and including the Harlem Piver. The view shows the Power Plant of the United Electric Light and Power Co.
June 8, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, from a point slightly eastward as seen across Sherman Creek (an inlet of the Harlem River) from Dyckman Street. In the background appear houses on the west shore of the Borough of the Bronx, across the Harlem River.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Academy Street,and East along Harlem River Driveway.
September 1929
George L. Halgue
